revised_title: Development and Metamorphosis of Ophiothrix Fragilis
tldr: The author studied the development and metamorphosis of Ophiothrix fragilis, a common species of British Ophiuroidea. They discovered two types of development, one resulting in a normal larva and the other in an abnormal one. The author also found that the condition of the egg at the moment of fertilization has a significant impact on the subsequent development and may be the origin of variations. The study has important implications for experimental studies using echinoderm eggs.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
